_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for Heinen Brothers Agra Services-Centralia, Kansas

For Further Information Regarding this Plan, Please Contact:
Scott Heinen
East Hwy 9
Centralia, Kansas  66415
785/857-3577

1. The Facility Policy
The owners and employees of Heinen Brothers Agra Services are committed to the prevention of accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department and other agencies to mitigate any release to people and the environment.

2.  Facility Information
This facility has the most current safety measures implemented at this time.  The primary activity at this facility is the storage of fertilizer for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received stored and distributed for direct application.  The ammonia is delivered by truck.

3.  The Accidental Release Prevention Program
The facility has implemented the provisions of Safety Requirements for the storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia K-61-1, published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc. and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Adminstration, 29 CFR 1910.111, Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia.

4. The Five Year Accident History
This facility has no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia that has caused any deaths, injured or caused significant property damage at the facility, or any offsite consequences of a release.

5.  The Emergency Action Plane
The Facility has:
-A written Emergency Action Plan
-It will provide SARA Title III information to the state and local authorities.
-Has done employee training

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Safety improvements will be an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic inspections are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations at this time.
